intro: Collinsia brucae, commonly known as the Sierra Valley bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Collinsia brucae is often found in California and Oregon, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
